intro: Tripterocalyx crux-maltae, commonly known as the Malta cross or Maltese cross, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with palmate leaves and produces bright yellow or orange blooms. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appearance. Due to its unique morphology, it is also of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
